snippet: Providence Hogan pleaded guilty to embezzling $82,000 while treasurer of the Public School 29 Parent-Teacher Association in Brooklyn and has fallen behind on scheduled repayments.
abstract: Providence Hogan, who pleaded guilty to embezzling $82,000 while she was treasurer of the Public School 29 Parent-Teacher Assn in Brooklyn, is taken back into custody after failing to make scheduled repayments; as part of a plea agreement, she returned over $50,000, but is still short about $17,700; Hogan could still face full sentence of two to six years if she does not make the full reimbursement by January 2014.
lead_paragraph: Providence Hogan pleaded guilty to embezzling $82,000 while treasurer of the Public School 29 Parent-Teacher Association in Brooklyn and has fallen behind on scheduled repayments.

headline.main: Former PTA Official Jailed After Failure to Repay Funds
headline.print_headline: Former PTA Official Jailed After Failure to Repay Funds
